Hace 11 años, María viene realizando su trabajo día a día, todas las mañanas se levanta y abre su negocio en donde tiene bebidas gaseosas y algunas alcohólicas que ofrece a sus clientes, ella es una mujer muy responsable y es por eso que no permite que ningún menor de edad entre a su establecimiento ya que siempre fue muy tímida con las normas sociales y una mujer que respeta sus obligaciones. Su local está ubicado en su casa, que acondicionó un espacio en donde puede atender a sus clientes. Antes su local era en casa de sus padres, pero como fue creciendo quiso tener su propia casa y así fue, que hace 2 años está viviendo en su casa propia.
Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite tener algunos momentos de relajo en las que hace sus que haceres del hogar, además que tiene buenos clientes que le permiten tener buenas ganancias. Espera seguir trabajando igual para seguir creciendo y aumentando su capital de trabajo. Este será el crédito número 16 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, Le gusta pertenecer al banco comunal al que trabaja ya que todos son responsables y muy solidarios entre si. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará mas bebidas para tener en stock ya que los fines de semana se queda muchas veces sin vender por falta de capital.
texts.en:
Maria, 46 years old, is a good, lovable, and enterprising woman who lives with Angel aged 59 with whom she has 3 children. She works a lot to be able to offer a better quality of life for her children, Laura (23), Mariela (21), and the youngest, Angel (18). She and her parents share their own house. 

For 11 years now Maria has been working every day; each morning she arises and opens her business where she sells soft drinks and some alcoholic beverages to her customers. She is a very responsible woman and for that reason, does not permit minors to enter her establishment. Maria has always upheld social norms and respected her obligations. Her business is located in her house where she prepared a space for attending to her customers. Previously, her business was located in her parents' house, but because business was growing and she wanted to have her own house, for the last 2 years she has lived and worked in her house.

Maria likes her work since it allows her to enjoy some moments of relaxation in which she can take care of household matters. Besides, she has good customers who bring her good earnings. She hopes to continue working as she has, in order to keep growing and increasing her working capital. 

This will be Maria's 16th loan through MFP. She is very content to be able to count on financial help to continue expanding. Maria likes belonging to her communal bank since everyone is responsible and very supportive of each other.

With the 3,000 new sols she is requesting, Maria will purchase drinks to have in stock, because on weekends she often can't fulfill customers' demands for lack of capital.

loans.use: buy more soft drinks and beer to sell.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca (fiber from abaca palm leaf) weaving business in the Philippines.

Juanita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more abaca for her business. She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Juanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more abaca for her business.

loans.name: Dionesia Tabernero

texts.en:
Dionesia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Dionesia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy sugar, mayonnaise and other ingredients for her business.

She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Dionesia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, mayonnaise and other ingredients.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella works hard to support her family. Estrella is married and has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines.

Estrella is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her trisikad transport business.

She is getting the trisikad transport because she wants to avoid future lung diseases resulting from continued toxic smoke inhalation.

Estrella is aware that by using the trisikad transport,she is saving money, she helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her trisikad transport business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is married and has a recycled materials business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 

Wilma requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more recycled materials to sell.

Wilma has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Alfie Rose

texts.en:
Alfie Rose is 28 years old, married and has three children who currently going to school.

Alfie Rose is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Alfie Rose has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Alfie Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is married and has six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lilibeth is 35 years old and has 3 children who are in school and the other has already work of their own.

Lilibeth has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Lilibeth has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a recycled materials retail business in the Philippines.

Lorna requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more recycled materials to resell. She has been in this business for five years now and also earns additional income from food vending.

Lorna would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva, de 53 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora dinámica, además de ser alegre y amable. Es conviviente con Eduardo quien se dedica al transporte de carga y es padre de sus 8 hijos quienes en su mayoría ya son independientes. Vive en compañía de último hijo Javier de 30 años de edad instalados cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Elva es la crianza de pollos de granja, para eso cuenta con un pequeño galpón con capacidad máxima de 200 pollos, que está instalado en la parte posterior de su casa. Ahí los cría y los vende en los mercados de la localidad, logrando vender toda su producción.
Iniciándose con un capital propio hace más de 33 años, que fue fruto de sus ahorros, y contando además con el apoyo de su pareja, quien se encarga de la limpieza y alimentación de los pollos. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene éste producto, por ser de consumo masivo en la alimentación diaria de la población. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder contar con un ingreso económico extra, para los gastos que se presentaran en el hogar. Por otro lado, lo que no le gusta de su actividad es que algunas veces se murieron parte su producción debido a la peste, ocasionándole pérdidas, por lo que tuvo que reiniciar gracias al apoyo de MFP, por eso tiene planes de continuar con su actividad y realizar algunos arreglos y mejoras a su galpón. Este será el préstamo número 12 con la institución MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, dice cumplirá con el pago de sus cuotas, para poder tener un buen record crediticio. Además de sentirse muy bien con su grupo comunal, pues los considera personas sociables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en el arreglo de la infraestructura de su galpón, comprando hojas de bijao para renovar el techado, viruta para el piso donde estarán los pollos bebes que será cerca de 100 pollitos.
texts.en:
Elva is 53 and is a dynamic, hard-working woman.  She is also happy and friendly.  She is in a common-law marriage with Eduardo, who transports cargo for a living.  He is the father of their 8 children, the majority of which are now independent.  She lives with her youngest son, Javier, who is 30, in their own home.  Elva raises chickens.  She has a small shed that has a maximum capacity of 200 chickens, which is located in back of her home.  There she raises them and sells them at markets in the area, managing to sell all of her production.

Elva stated her business with her own capital that was the fruit of her savings more than 33 years ago.  She also has the support of Eduardo, who is in charge of cleaning and feeding the chickens.  She considers her business to be rather profitable due to the demand that this product has.  It is consumed in mass as part of the daily diet of the population.  What she likes most about her job is being able to have extra economic income for her home's expenses.  On the other hand, what she doesn't like is that sometimes part of her production dies due to plagues, and she has occasional losses.  This is why she had to start over thanks to the support of Microfinanzas Prisma.  She has plans to continue her work and to make some repairs and improvements to her shed.  This will be her twelfth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she hopes that through it she can make her plans concrete.  She will make all of her payments on time so she can have a good credit record.  She feels very good about her communal bank.  She thinks the members are sociable and supportive.  With the requested amount of 1,000 PEN, she will invest in the repair of her shed's infrastructure.  She will buy bijao leaves to update the roof and wood chips for the floor where she will have close to 100 baby chicks.

loans.use: to buy bijao leaves and wood chips to reconstruct her shed.

loans.name: Meyga

texts.es:
Meyga, de 30 años, es una mujer amable, buena y emprendedora, es conviviente con Manuel de 30 años con quien tiene dos hijos, Joao de 10 y Luana de 2 años. Ella vive en casa de los padres de su conviviente y aunque vive ahí, separa sus gastos ya que son familias diferentes. Meyga, durante algunos períodos de tiempo del mes, se va a la ciudad de Lima o Trujillo en donde encuentra los calzados mas cómodos para su posterior venta. Además de hacer éste negocio, también tiene un catalogo con los calzados mas exclusivos de buena calidad del mercado, durante su tiempo libre sale a vender entre sus amigos, vecinos o familiares y diferentes clientes que gano en los ultimo 2 años que viene realizando este negocio. Durante el tiempo que trabaja paso muchas cosas y ella aprende de cada una de las experiencias que tiene pues es una mujer que aprende todos los días y eso le aplica a mejorar su carácter y trato a los clientes. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues le permite mucho tiempo libre para brindar a sus hijos y a su esposo, en los últimos meses mejoró mucho las ventas y es por eso que desea aumentar su capital para cubrir con todos los pedidos de sus clientes. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, además está convencida que seguirá siendo la socia buena y responsable de los créditos obtenidos anteriormente, le gusta pertenecer al banco comunal al que trabaja ya que todos son responsables y muy solidarios entre si.
Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará mas calzados para tener en stock y así cubrir con todos los pedidos de sus clientes que va en aumento.
texts.en:
Meyga, 30, is a good, friendly and hardworking woman. She lives with her partner, also 30, with whom she has two children, Joao, 10, and Luana, 2. She lives in her partner’s parent’s home, however she keeps household expenses separate, since they form two different family units. 

Several times a month, Meyga goes to the cities of Lima or Trujillo where she finds the most comfortable footwear to sell later. In addition, she also sells the most exclusive, high quality shoes by catalog. During her spare time she leaves home to sell to her friends, neighbors, relatives and the other customers she has attracted over the two years  she has been engaged in the shoe business.

During her working hours many things happen and she learns from each experience, since she is a woman who continues to learn every day and then applies what she learns to improving her character and her service to her customers. She greatly enjoys her work since it enables her plenty of free time to spend with her children and husband.

In recent months her sales have greatly improved. Consequently she would like to increase her capital to cover all of her customer’s sales orders. This will be her third loan with MFP. She is very happy to know she will have financial help so that she can continue increasing her working capital. As well, she is sure that she will continue being as good and responsible a member as she was with loans she obtained previously.

Meyga enjoys belonging to the communal bank, which works because all the women are responsible and supportive of one another. She will use the S/. 2,500 requested to purchase more shoes to have in stock so she can meet increasing customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to stock her business.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam, de 41 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Jorge su esposo desde hace 10 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad del Tambo. En su casa desarrollo sus negocio, de esa manera puede estar en compañía de sus hijos y educarlos. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, en su tienda de comestibles. Mientras que su esposo abrió un taller automotriz al costado de su casa. Ya tienen muchos años dedicándose a ello y espera poder desarrollar más sus negocios. Durante los 12 años de experiencia, pudo aprender todo lo necesario de ahorrar dinero y mejorar sus ingresos. Comprar alimentos en cantidad, para poder vender un poco menos que las demás tiendas. Ahora invirtió todo el capital que tenía en aumentar su mercadería, por ello espera un apoyo para los estudios de sus hijos. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde se siente contento de recibir el apoyo económico para progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Miriam de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de útiles escolares para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miriam is 41 years old and a hard-working woman. She has lived with her husband Jorge for ten years. Together they have three children whom they care for in their own home, which is located in the town of Tambo. 

She runs her business out of her house so that she can spend time with her children and educate them. She makes a living selling basic products in her grocery store. Meanwhile, her husband opened an automotive shop at the side of their house. They have dedicated many years to their businesses and hope to be able to develop them more. During her 12 years of experience, Miriam was able to learn everything necessary to save money and improve her income. She buys food in bulk so that she can sell it at slightly lower prices than the other stores. Having invested all her capital to increase her merchandise, she is now seeking support for her children's studies. 

This is her ninth loan with MFP, where she is pleased to receive economic support to grow her business. Moreover, she promises to be punctual with her payments, as her communal bank is comprised of responsible and supportive people. Upon receiving support, Miriam will use the money she requested to buy school supplies for her children.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Grupo Peñitas Group

texts.es:
EL grupo Peñitas se encuentra formado por seis mujeres trabajadoras, decidieron llamarse así porque es el nombre del área donde viven.
Dentro del grupo se encuentra Enriqueta, a la que cariñosamente apodan “Doña Queta”, viuda y con una hija que trabaja, se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos en un mercado de la ciudad. Hace ocho años aproximadamente inició este negocio porque necesitaba salir adelante ya que  había enviudado.
Doña Queta quiere surtir más zapatos y aspira con poner un local más grande para asegurar su futuro cuando se retire.
texts.en:
The Peñitas group is made up of six hard-working women. They decided to call the group "Peñitas" because that is the name of the area in which they live. 

One group member, Enriqueta, whom they have affectionately nicknamed "Doña Queta," is a widow with a working daughter. She makes her living selling clothes and shoes in the city market. She started this business about eight years ago because she needed to move forward after having been widowed. 

Doña Queta wants to stock more shoes and aspires to have a larger venue so as to secure her future after she retires.

loans.use: To stock clothes and shoes in greater quantities in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Bunavsha

texts.ru: Бунавша активная и трудолюбивая девушка, она 1984 года рождения и имеет 12 летний опыт в бизнесе. Она занимается купле- продажей женских тканей на рынке.  С детства она занималась данным бизнесом, вначале помогала брату, а сейчас работает самостоятельно. Имеет собственную торговую точку для ведения своего бизнеса. Данный бизнес налажен на позитивную сторону, и она имеет много постоянных клиентов. Бунавша запрашивает займ для покупки сезонных женских тканей с целью расширения ассортимента. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Bunavsha is an active and hardworking young woman, she was born in 1984 and has a twelve year experience in this business. She buys and sells women's fabrics on the market. She has been doing this business since childhood by helping her brother in the beginning and now working independently. She has her own vendor space to run her business. This business is well tuned on the positive side and Bunavsha has many regular customers. She is asking for a loan to buy seasonal women's fabrics with the goal to increase variety. She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Hildegath

texts.es: Hildegath, de 46 años, es una mujer amable, buena y muy responsable, está separada del que fue su conviviente por muchos años y con quien tuvo cuatro hijos. Desde hace mucho tiempo trabaja duro para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, es así como tres de sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes, mientras que solo una hija llamada Karla vive a su lado y depende de ella para su educación. El trabajo de Hildegath consiste en la pesca, ella tiene dos botes de capacidad muy amplia, durante lapsos de tiempo ella equipa y organiza a su equipo de pesca, entre los cuales tiene a cinco personas, una vez que tiene a su tripulación armada y equipada los envía a pescar por las aguas del río Ucayali. En el transcurso de la pesca siempre esta monitoreando a sus trabajadores a través de radios y teléfonos celulares en algunas zonas en donde hay señal, esto lo hace para tener un buen control y sobre todo para saber si sus trabajadores tienen alguna necesidad. Durante sus cinco años en éste trabajo ha aprendido mucho, tanto así que de no saber nada de lo que hacia, se convirtió en una excelente administradora de los botes. Le gusta lo que hace, tiene buenos ingresos y su trabajo en tierra solo es colocar el resultado de los días de pesca entre los compradores y comerciantes de pescado de la ciudad, espera seguir trabajando igual y más adelante ampliar con un bote mas en su flota. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, además se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en el anterior crédito que tuvo. Dice estar contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son responsables y muy buenos entre ellos. Con el monto solicitado comprará algunas herramientas y materiales que necesita para poder continuar con su trabajo, entre las cosas serán, redes, anzuelos y algunas provisiones para la alimentación de sus trabajadores.
texts.en: Hildegath, who is 46 years old, is a friendly, good and very responsible woman.  She is separated from her partner of many years with whom she had four children.  For a long time, she worked hard to give her family a better quality of life.  And so 3 of her children are grown and live independently while one daughter, Karla lives with Hildegath and depends on her for her education.  Hildegath's works is fishing.  She has two large-capacity boats.  She spends periods of time fitting and organizing her fishing equipment.  She has five people working for her.  Once her she has her crew assembled and equipped, she sends them out to fish the waters of the Ucayali river.  During the fishing, she constantly monitors her workers via radio and cellular phone, in the zones that have a signal.  She does this to maintain control and especially to know if her workers are in need of anything.  During her five years in this work, Hildegath has learned a lot, so much that she went from not knowing what she was doing at all to becoming an excellent administrator of her boats.  Hildegath likes what she does, she earns a good income and her work on land is only laying out the day's catch for the buyers and the city's fish traders.  She hopes to keep working the same and down the line to expand by adding another boat to her fleet.  This will be her second loan with MFP, and she is very happy knowing that she will have financial support, which will help to assure her that she will be able to advance her business.  In addition, she promises once again to be timely in the repayment of her loan, just as with the last one.  She says she is happy to belong to her communal bank, since all the members are responsible and very good to each other.  With her requested sum, she will purchase some tools and materials that she needs to keep working such as nets, hooks and some provisions to feed her workers.

loans.use: to purchase nets, hooks and some provisions to feed her workers.

loans.name: Saidjon

texts.ru: Саидчон добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Саидчон занимается купле- продажей скота, а также выращиванием ячменя. В данный момент у него 6 голов крупного и 50 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Саидчон планирует расширить свой бизнес и открыт свою ферму. В бизнесе помогают жена, отец и мать. Саидчон запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки скота и корма для них.
texts.en: Saidjon is a kind and hard-working person. He is married and is raising two children. Saidjon buys and sells livestock, and also grows barley. Presently, he has 6 cows and 50 goats and sheep, but is planning to expand his business and start his own farm. His wife, father and mother help with the business. Saidjon is requesting a loan of 5000 somoni to buy livestock and animal feed.

loans.use: To buy livestock and animal feed

loans.name: Tavakal

texts.ru: Тавакал женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. На протяжении 10 лет он занимается купле- продажей скота и выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. В бизнесе помогает жена и старший сын. Тавакал запрашивает займ в размере 3000 сомони и надеется на вашу щедрость. Полученный займ он хочет потратить на покупку скота, семян и горюче-смазочных материалов. Он хочет приобрести  крупный рогатый скот  и 2 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Полученную прибыль от займа намерен использовать на улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Tavakal is married and a responsible father of four children. For the past 10 years, he has been raising livestock and growing crops. His wife and oldest son help with the business. Tavakal is requesting a loan of 3000 somoni and is hoping for your generosity. He would like to use this loan to buy livestock and seeds, as well as fuel and lubricants. He is planning to buy cattle and 2 goats or sheep. Tavakal is going to use his profits from this loan to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy livestock, seeds, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Umriniso

texts.ru: Умринисо трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Муж работает в Российской Федерации строителем. Умринисо занимается купле- продажей скота, а также выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Данный момент она имеет 2 голов крупного рогатого скота. Она хочет получить хороший урожай, чтобы получить хорошую прибыль. За полученный доход хочет купить крупный рогатый скот. Умринисо запрашивает займ в размере 4000 Сомони для покупки семян ячменя, пшеницы и горюче-смазочных материалов. Умринисо надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Umriniso is a hard-working and kind woman. She is married and a loving mother of two children. Her husband works as a construction worker in Russia. Umriniso grows crops and raises livestock, and currently has two cows. She wants to collect a good harvest and make a decent profit, with which she would like to buy additional cattle. Umriniso is requesting a loan of 4000 somoni to purchase seeds of barley and wheat, as well as fuel and lubricants. She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Buzainap

texts.ru: Бузайнап 48 лет,  воспитывает дочь.   В 2000 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Бузайнап начала свой бизнес в торговле ткаными изделиями, такими как скатерти, полотенца со стартовой суммой в 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Бузайнап сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Бузайнап  обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Бузайнап  планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Buzainap is 48 years old; she is raising a daughter. In 2000, in the search of source of income for her family, Buzainap launched a business selling linens, such as tablecloths and towels, with a starting capital of 20,000 KGS. Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Buzainap has been able to grow her business, which now brings in a monthly income of 15,000. At present she is running low on stock, and this is why Buzainap turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS. Buzainap plans to reinvest the revenues earned thanks to her loan in further development of her business.

loans.use: toexpand her stock of goods.

loans.name: Estardo

texts.es: Estardo, de 40 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, además de ser muy alegre y amable.  Es conviviente con Margarita quien es ama de casa y madre de su hijo Efraín de 18 años de edad.  Vive en compañía de su pareja e hijo, a los que quiere mucho, habitando en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Estardo es la comercialización de abarrotes, para esto abrió una pequeña bodega en su propia casa, desde atiende las necesidades de sus vecinos, quienes son sus principales clientes. También se dedica a la pesca artesanal contando con un bote pequeño. Sin embargo considera rentable el negocio de abarrotes por las ganancias que le deja, ya que por la zona no hay rubro similar. Le gusta su actividad, el atender a su público además se distrae, pero lo más importante es que se siente productivo, con lo que logra pagar los gastos del hogar. Tiene planes de ampliar y convertirlo en un minimarket con variados productos a la venta. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta de poder contar su apoyo, por ello se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 4000 nuevos soles, los invertirá la mitad en la compra de abarrotes de primera necesidad, con los cuales surtir su bodega, así podrá seguir creciendo con su negocio. Y con el saldo, materiales para la pesca artesanal como redes, trampas, hilos de pesca y otros, así continuar teniendo más ingresos.
texts.en: Estardo is 40 and is a hard-working and enterprising man.  He is also very happy and friendly.  He is in a common-law marriage with Margarita, who is a housewife and the mother of their son, Efraín, who is 18.  Estardo lives with Margarita and Efraín, whom he loves very much, in their own home.  He makes a living selling groceries.  He has a small store in their home, where he attends to the needs of his neighbors, who are his main customers.  He also fishes with a small boat.  He considers his grocery business to be very profitable since there isn't a similar business in their area.  He likes his job.  Attending to the public distracts him, but more importantly, he feels productive because he can pay for his home's expenses.  He has plans to expand and convert his store into a mini-market where he can sell a variety of products.  This will be his third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  He is happy to be able to have their support.  He promises to make all of his payments on time.  With the requested amount of 4,000 PEN, he will invest half in the purchase of basic groceries to stock his store so it will be able to keep growing.  With the rest, he will buy fishing supplies like nets, baskets, fishing lines, etc., to continue making more income.

loans.use: to buy products to stock his store like nets, baskets, and fishing lines.

loans.name: Sokhna Ramatoulaye

texts.fr:
Madame Sokhna Ramatoulaye est âgée de 45 ans et habite dans une des banlieues du Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce et  vends des tissus et des chaussures. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par nécessité dans le souci de subvenir à ses propres besoins.
Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC de sa localité et sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour honorer ses engagements vis-à-vis de ses fournisseurs. Ce financement  lui permettra de continuer son activité sans perturbation. Ainsi es bénéfices qui en découlent l’aident a améliorer son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhna Ramatoulaye is 45 years old. She lives in a suburb in Senegal. She is a vendor selling fabric and shoes. She has chosen this business with the goal of supporting herself.

She is a member of her local branch of U-IMCEC and seeking 100,000 francs to pay her suppliers. This financing will allow her to continue her activity without interruptions. The resulting profits [will] help her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for an order of fabric and shoes intended for resale.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru: Акбар женат и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Более 6 лет он занимается предоставлением транспортных услуг. В начале он арендовал автомашину, а затем постепенно накопив деньги купил себе автомобиль. Теперь он занимается этим бизнесом на собственной автомашине. Кроме того он занимается скотоводством. Акбар запрашивает займ для покупки запчастей для ремонта автомашины. На остальную сумму хочет купить скот.
texts.en: Akbar is married and is raising four children.  He has been providing taxi services for over 6 years.  When he began, he rented a car.  But after saving his money little by little, he bought his own car.  Now, he runs his own business with his own car.  Besides this, he breeds cattle.  Akbar is requesting a loan to buy spare parts in order to repair his car.  With the remaining money, he wants to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in order to repair his car

loans.name: Mamasharif

texts.ru: Мамашариф женат и на воспитании имеет пятерых детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Более 31 года Мамашариф занимается приготовлением национальных блюд. Он работает шеф-поваром в национальной столовой. Готовит разные виды национальных блюд. Его столовая находится на центре города, где много народа, и много посетителей в его  столовой.  Мамашариф запрашивает займ для покупки столов и стульев для столовой.
texts.en: Mamasharif is married and is raising five children.  His wife takes care of their home.  Mamasharif has been making traditional dishes for over 31 years.  He is the executive chef in a traditional eatery.  He prepares various types of traditional dishes.   His eatery is located in the center of the city where there are a lot of people where he has many customers.  Mamasharif is requesting a loan for the purchase of tables and chairs for his eatery.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs for his eatery

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.ru: Гулназ 34 года,  воспитывает троих детей, старшей из которых 8 лет.  Так как Гулназ является единственным кормильцем для своей семьи, в 2008 году, в поисках источника дохода, онаначала свой бизнес в торговле женской одежды со стартовой суммой в 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Гулназ сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров на идущий сезон не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Гулназ обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Гулназ  планирует вложить в проведение ремонта дома, а в дальнейшем - в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulnaz is 34 years old and is raising three children, the oldest of whom is 8 years old.  As her family's only bread winner, and in search of a source of income, in 2008 she began her business selling women's clothes with starting funds of 30,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Gulnaz was able to develop her business into one with a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).

Today, her assortment of merchandise for the current season isn't too big, and for this reason she has applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 55,000 som (KGS).  Gulnaz plans to invest the income generated by her loaned funds in home repairs, and in the future development of her business.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: Piedad Higuita

texts.es:
Piedad es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora, y esto le ha permitido superar todas las adversidades que le ha presentado la vida. Piedad ofrece el servicio de banquetes para eventos, servicio que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser de muy buena calidad. Gracias a esto, Piedad genera los ingresos necesarios para contribuir con los gastos de su hogar y ofrecer una buena calidad de vida a su hija. Piedad ha tenido que superar una gran adversidad que fue una operación de una hernia en su cuerpo, lo que le ha dificultado enormemente las labores de su negocio. A pesar de esto, Piedad siempre ha tenido la fortaleza suficiente para salir adelante. Debido a que su negocio lo montó con muy bajo capital y quiere comprar artículos con los que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio, Piedad busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de manteles, cristalería y demás insumos que requiere en su negocio para ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Piedad espera que de esta manera su negocio siga creciendo y siga ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Además, Piedad espera que con mayores ingresos su familia goce de una mejor calidad de vida. Piedad sueña con tener un gran negocio y poder ubicarse en un salón donde pueda ofrecer el servicio completo.
texts.en:
Piedad always has been a very hardworking person.  This has allowed her to overcome all the adversities that life has presented.  Piedad offers banquet service for events, a service that always has been of a very good quality.  Thanks to this, Piedad generates the necessary income to help with the household expenses and offer her daughter a good quality of life.

Piedad has had to overcome a great adversity, a hernia operation, which has made her work in the business enormously difficult.  In spite of this, Piedad always has had sufficient strength to get ahead.  Because she set up her business with very low capital and she wants to buy items with which to give her customers good service, Piedad looks for a loan to give her the possibility of buying tablecloths, glassware, and other supplies that she needs in her business to give good service.

Piedad hopes that in this way her business will continue growing and giving good service to her customers.  In addition, Piedad hopes that with greater income her family will enjoy a better quality of life.  Piedad dreams about having a big business and being able to set herself up in a hall where she can give complete service.

loans.use: to buy tablecloths, glassware, and other supplies for her business to give her customers good service.

loans.name: Tessie Barrientos

texts.en:
Tessie is 52 years old, married, and has 5 children. She has a carinderia stall (or small restaurant) beside a municipal park and local hospitals. Tessie cooks Filipino meals like chicken and pork adobo and caldereta; her menu also includes vegetable options. She has managed the business for 14 years.

Tessie wants to improve her and her family's standard of living. She reinvests the earnings from her carinderia in other businesses for her additional sources of income. Tessie says that, since she started the business, she has plenty of costumers because she provides good services.

Tessie needs additional capital to satisfy her current costumers and extend her services to new customers. She is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, meats, vegetables, and ingredients for the food she sells in her stall. She hopes to maintain her business and her costumers.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, meats, vegetables and other ingredients.

loans.name: Marivic Cabanit

texts.en: Marivic is 46 years old, and she has one child. She is married to a farmer who helps her in her business. She owns a small cantina and has requested a loan to buy more ingredients to make food for her customers. With the profits, she plans to save and pay school fees for her children. She would like to be a distributor for customers who work far from her cantina.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida, holding the Asasah passbook in the photo, is the mother of three sons and three daughters. All of them are enrolled in school locally and getting their education. Zubaida is a great mother and takes care of her children very well.

Zubaida's husband operates a thread-making business. He has great marketing skills and has good business contacts in the market, to whom he supplies thread on demand.

Zubaida has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband, who wants to buy a new thread-making machine. By purchasing a new machine, he will be able to make a larger quantity and better quality of thread and earn more profits. Her husband has been operating his business for many years, and Zubaida is confident that this loan will help his business succeed.

loans.use: to buy a thread-making machine for her business.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris, de 47 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, además de sociable y muy amable. Está  separada del padre de sus 4 hijos Mónica de 28, Luís de 26, Walter de 21 y Nancy de 14 años de edad.  Vive en compañía de sus hijos,  cómodamente instalados en su propia casa. La actividad que tiene Doris es la venta de comida como desayunos consistentes en platos preparados, instalándose todos los días en el frontis de su casa, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos y transeuntes de la zona, logando ganarse su preferencia. Iniciándose hace más de 28 años, que empezó con un capital propio, luego hizo prestamos bancarios; así fue que continuo con su trabajo. Ahora cuenta con el apoyo una ayudante en la preparación y atención de sus clientes quien paga por semana trabajada. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta mucho su negocio pues le agrada la cocina y preparar nuevos tipos de comidas llegando a sorprender a sus clientes. Ahora lo que más desea es ampliar su negocio y abrir un restaurante en su casa, donde pueda atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Este será el préstamo número 13 con la  institución MFP, Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevo soles desea comprar utensilios para la cocina, así como mesas y sillas para ampliar y mejorar su negocio y de esa manera dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. También en el arreglo de su techo, ya que mucho llueve por su zona.
texts.en:
Doris, 47, is a hardworking and energetic woman, as well as being very social and friendly. She's separated from the father of her four children - Monica, 28; Luis, 26; Walter, 21; and Nancy, 14. She lives comfortably with her children in the home she owns. Doris's work is selling food like daily prepared breakfasts. She works every day in front of her home, where she amiably tends to her customers, mostly her neighbors and passersby whose preference she has won. She started more than 28 years ago with her own capital, and later took out bank loans that allowed her to continue with her work. Now she has the support of an assistant to prepare the food and attend to the customers who pay per work week. Her business is pretty profitable and gives her a good income. 

She likes her business a lot because she enjoys cooking and making new types of meals to surprise her customers. What she wants most right now is to increase the size of her business and open a restaurant in her home where she can give her customers more comfort. This will be her 13th loan with MFP. She hopes for a small loan to help her achieve her objectives. For her part, she promises once again to make her payments as she did with previous loans. She is grateful to be part of the village bank because all of the members are responsible and united. With the requested 2000 nuevos soles she will buy cooking implements as well as tables and chairs to grow and improve her business and give her customers better service. She will also fix her roof because it rains a lot in that area.

loans.use: to buy cooking implements, tables and chairs, and to fix the roof on her building.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is 26 years old. She is happily married with two children. Lilit and her husband are involved in agriculture. They have been running their farm for seven years, where they cultivate potatoes and beans and breed cattle and fish. Lilit has applied for this loan for land cultivation in the spring. With the loan's help, she will purchase seeds and fuel for agriculture. Lilit also plans to use the loan to purchase food for her fish. 
Lilit hopes to gather a good harvest this year and get more income to develop her farm. Additional income will also allow Lilit to improve the family's living conditions by renovating her house.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fuel, and, food for fish.

loans.name: Khuth

texts.en:
Khuth lives in Dongkor commune, Phnom Penh city. She owns a beauty salon that is in front of a shoe factory.  She has worked as a hair dresser for 6 years. She offers also hair removal, make-up, pedicures and manicures. She works honestly and that is why she has many clients using her services. Moreover, she also acts as a seamstress with experience. She restores clothes and other outerwear. Typically, she is able to make income of USD 6.50 per day. She is married and has a school-aged kid.

Khuth would like to take out a loan from HKL to buy products for the beauty salon and purchase clothes for tailoring. Khuth hopes to expand her store and make it larger than the one she has now and wants to save money for her child’s education.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for tailoring and buy products for the beauty salon

loans.name: Fahed

texts.en:
Fahed is a 32-year-old married man from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan and a father of three children

Fahed is trading in used furniture. He is requesting a loan of 2,000 JD to purchase more furniture for trading purposes.

Fahed is looking to have branches for his shop in different locations.

loans.use: to purchase used furniture to sell

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a conservative person. She is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet so the woman in the photo is her daughter, Sarah. Sahar is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of two children.

Seven  years ago, Sahar established her own beauty salon and she worked hard to brand it and increase her customer base. Now Sahar's salon is well known in her area and she is looking to add additional improvements to modernize it. Sahar is requesting a loan of 1,800 JD to purchase tools and products needed for the salon.

loans.use: to purchase tools and products for her salon

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar, holding the Asasah passbook in the photo, has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s animal selling business. With the loan, he will buy young animals such as goats and sheep. He will raise them and sell them for profit.

Kosar is also a working lady. She makes sweaters and sells them in the local market. She has given birth to six children. Only one of them is able to attend school.

Kosar is very confident that her husband will make good use of the loan and successfully improve his business and  that she will be in position to send her younger children to school in the near future.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for sale.

loans.name: Edna Ginez

texts.en:
Edna is 50 years old, married, and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Sto. Domingo in the province of Isabela. Her main source of income is raising pigs for breeding. She has been in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

Edna is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Edna hopes that someday her hog raising business will improve so that she can better provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is 40 years of age. She is very active and performs her household duties very actively. 
She also does decorative embroidery and prepares beautiful clothes for her clients. She knows about the latest trends in clothing which helps her in fulfilling her clients' requirements.
Her husband sells local food called samosay.  His food is very tasty and he makes reasonable income from his business. 
When Naseem is free, she helps her husband in his business by preparing samosay with potatoes.
She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her eldest son who also sells samosay. With the loan investment, he will purchase potatoes, spices and other ingredients used in making better quality samosay. 
He has operated his business for many years and Naseem is hopeful about his business success after investing the loan funds.

Note:”In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Naseem.”

loans.use: To buy potatoes, spices and cooking oils for food selling business

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 35-year-old divorced woman from Sahab, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Nada is selling cosmetics and perfumes from her home. Nada is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase more quantities of perfumes and cosmetics for trading purposes. Nada is looking to improve her family's living conditions and to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Salah Al Dein

texts.en:
Salah Al Dein is a 35-year-old married man from Al Russeifeh, Jordan and a father of four children.

Salah Al Dein is a mechanic who is requesting a loan of 1,500 JD to purchase new equipment for his store.

Salah Al Dein is looking to add additional improvements to his store and increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment

loans.name: Narine Isajanyan

texts.en:
Narine is 25 years old. She lives with her husband and two small children. Narine runs a farm, where she cultivates potatoes and beans and breeds livestock and sheep. Her husband helps her to run the farm. Over the last seven years, through their hard work, the couple has developed the farm and insured a stable source of income for their children. 

Narine has applied for this loan to develop her cattle breeding business. With the requested amount, she plans to purchase livestock. She expects to increase her income by expanding her farm. She dreams of insuring access to higher education for her children in the future. The development of her farm is vital for her to implement her dream.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Elichka

texts.en:
Elichka lives in Shikahogh village with her husband. The couple has been involved in beekeeping for 10 years now. The main source of income for the family comes from gathering honey and selling it in Kapan and Yerevan cities, where this product is in big demand. 
To get more income from beekeeping, Elichka has some plans to increase the number of beehives. Thus, she has applied for this loan to purchase beehives. Additional income is vital for Elichka to improve her household conditions and live better.

loans.use: to purchase beehives

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Fatimah is a conservative person who is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. Thus, the man in the photo is her husband.

Fatimah is a 43-year-old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Fatimah is selling wedding gowns and dresses. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 JD to purchase wedding gowns for trading purposes.

Fatimah is looking to open a shop for her business since she is currently working from her home with an aspiration of purchasing a house for the family.

loans.use: to purchase wedding gowns for trading purposes

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 31-year-old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Samar is a tailor who works from her home and is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase materials needed.

Samar is looking to establish her own workshop with an aspiration of purchasing a house for the family in addition to providing a good amount of money to insure her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as fabrics, thread, etc

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia, holding the Asasah passbook in the photo, has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy beads, embroidery frames, and clothing in bulk, which will allow her to offer better quality services to her clients and make more profits. She is very skillful and loves her work. Razia's husband works and supports her, while her five children do embroidery at home. She is a very confident lady and has a good number of clients who give her regular orders. She is very confident about the future growth and improvement of her business after investing the loan.

Razia wants to give her eldest daughter, who is 24 years old, in marriage, and she hopes that she will be able to provide a dowry with her increased income.

loans.use: to buy beads and embriodery frames for her embriodery business.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity lives in Yei. She has been running a food stall for five years. She is 40 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are still in school. 

Charity heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Saidnemat

texts.ru: Саиднеъмат женат и на воспитании имеет троих несовершеннолетних детей. Супруга занимается домохозяйством. Саиднеъмат занимается предоставлением транспортных услуг (такси) на собственном автомобиле с 2010-го года. Ежедневно он зарабатывает на жизнь и обеспечивает свои нужды. Саиднеъмат запрашивает займ для ремонта своего автомобиля с целью высококачественного обслуживания клиента. Саиднеъмат надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Saidnemat is married and is raising three underage children. His wife is a homemaker. Saidnemat is providing a taxi service on his own car since 2010. He makes his living daily and provides for his needs. Saidnemat is asking for a loan to repair his car with the goal to provide a high quality service for his clients. Saidnemat is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Mukhabat

texts.ru: Мухабат 49 лет, замужем,  воспитала 4 детей.  В 1995 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Мухабат начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммой в 1,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Мухабат сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 10,000 сом (KGS) с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях увеличения поголовья скота за счет покупки 2 дойных коров и 6 овец, Мухабат обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Мухабат планирует вложить в проведение ремонта дома, а в дальнейшем - в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Mukhabat is 49 years old, married and has raised four children. While looking for a source of income for her family Mukhabat started her business in 1995 doing animal husbandry with a starting capital of 1,000 som (KGS). Through persistence and hard work Mukhabat was able to grow her business with a monthly income of 10,000 KGS from the sale of milk and dairy products. With the goal to increase the headcount of livestock by buying two milk cows and six sheep Mukhabat has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS. Mukhabat plans to invest the income from the loan to repair her home and in the future into growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 51 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de alegre y solidaria. Es conviviente con José  quien es empleado y padre de sus 6 hijos que en su mayoría son independientes. Está habitando cómodamente una casa que es de su propiedad, en compañía de su pareja y su ultima hija, Francis de 10 años de edad a quien quiere mucho. La actividad que realiza Isabel es la venta de comida tales como tallarines, pollos fritos, juanes, arroz chaufa y otros, tanto en las mañanas como desayunos y almuerzos, para eso instala su mesa en el frontis de su casa, que cuenta con un techado para la protección de sus clientes, todos los días por las mañanas. 
Ella se inicio hace mas de 1 año,  atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus propios vecinos y amistades, llegando a acabar todo lo que prepara, contando con la ayuda de su nuera quien también tiene un capital que invertió en éste negocio. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Le gusta  su actividad ya que le permite distraerse y estar ocupada, además de brindarle el oficio de cocinar que aprendió de su madre, logrando tener una regular clientela que le deja buenas ganancias. Este será el préstamo 3 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para poder cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a ser puntal con el pago de sus cuotas, como en créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, desea comprar abarrotes de primera necesidad para empezar con su nuevo negocio buscando precios más bajos para así tener mejores ganancias. También ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de comidas y utensilios como platos, tasas y demás.
texts.en:
Isabel, 51, is a hardworking woman, as well as being happy and supportive.  She lives with José, an employee and the father of her six children, the majority of whom are independent.  She is living comfortably in a house she owns, with her partner and her last daughter, Francis, 10, whom she loves very much.

The work she does is selling food such as spaghetti, fried chicken, "juanes" [similar to tamales, except made with rice and stuffed with fish, chicken, or yucca], "arroz chaufa" [fried rice], and other things, both for breakfast in the morning and for lunches.  For this she sets up her table in the front of her house, with a roof to protect the customers, every day in the morning.

She started more than a year ago, very cordially serving her customers, who are mostly her own neighbors and friends, who finishes everything she prepares.  She has the help of her daughter-in-law who also invested some capital in this business.  She considers her business to be very profitable for the good profits it gives her.

She likes her job because it allows her to amuse herself and be busy.  It also gives her the job of cooking that she learned from her mother, managing to have a regular clientele that gives her good profits.

This will be her third loan with the MFP institution.  She hopes for a small loan to be able to realize her objectives.  On the other hand, she promises to be punctual in making her payments, as with the previous loans.

With the requested amount of 1500 nuevos soles (PEN) she wants to buy groceries to begin with her new business, looking for lower prices to have better profits.  She also wants to buy the necessary ingredients to make food, and utensils such as plates, glasses, and others.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, kitchen utensils, and basic household necessities to set up a store.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 25-year-old married woman and mother of one child. Five years ago she got married and moved to her husband's village and started her own business: a mobile phone selling shop.  She used to work in an accessories shop, which she left when she got married.

Hiba is a hard-working woman who can't stop working at all.  In addition to selling mobile phones, Hiba introduces her customers to new accessories, gifts and cosmetics that she is also selling. Hiba wants perfection in her business.  She applied for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy used mobile phones to sell at special prices.  She hopes to improve and expand her business more and more in the future.

loans.use: buy used mobile phones

loans.name: Khalifeh Group

texts.en:
Nahiya is a 36-year-old married woman, who has operated a clothing shop for 18 months.  She is a hardworking woman, who works hard to support her family in their living. Nahiya is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her merchandise with a special spring-summer collection to be ready for her customers needs.  Nahiya hopes to open another branch in the future. 

Mouna is a 39-year-old teacher, who is preparing herself for her wedding.  She provides good education to her students.  Being a tutor is a hard work to do but she is now used to it.  She is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to start an extra business to support her married life.
She hopes to make good living for her family in the future.

Nour is a 17-year-old single tutor, who works to cover her university fees and make her living.  Nour is a hardworking girl who dreams of finishing her studies an starting her own career  In order to do so, Nour has to pay fees to the university, that cover most of the requested projects.  She applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to cover her university fees.  She hopes that her future will be exactly as she dreams, starting her own successful business in Media, which is her major at the university. 

Nour is a 19-year-old single tutor, she is studying business at the university, and is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay for her university fees. She hopes to be a banker, since she loves all financial work and communication with people.  She hopes that her students will be important people in the future.

loans.use: To pay for their university fees and improve their businesses

loans.name: Al Sadaka Group

texts.en:
Samira is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. In 2009, she started selling Brazilian gold and beauty cosmetics. Samira works from her house to manage both her business and family issues. Her husband supported her a lot at the beginning and now she is capable enough to manage her business as much as she can.

Samira is a hardworking woman. She applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase her products with a new cosmetics collection necessary for the spring/summer season.

Samira hopes to expand her business more and more in the future and stay capable of supporting her family as much as she can.

Fawziya is a 62-year-old divorced woman with no children. She worked hard to start her own business so that she wouldn't need anyone's help. Fifteen years ago, Fawziya started selling clothes with the help of her sister's children, who gave her the capital requested to start a business of her own. It was a hard step to take, but she had to make her own career.

With the requested loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, Fawziya will start selling Brazilian gold and beauty cosmetics in addition to clothes, attracting enough customers. She hopes she can go to France during the sales season to buy special clothes that fit her customers’ needs and satisfy their desires.

Fatima is a 33-year-old married woman and mother of three children. In 2007, she started her own business selling Brazilian gold and beauty cosmetics. Her husband helped her a lot at the beginning. He led her to most of the dealers and she is dealing with them these days. Fatima is a courageous woman who works hard to reach her goals. Fatima is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase her products. She found a shop which she intends to rent and will make the necessary changes in it to open it very soon. Fatima hopes to succeed more and more in her business in the future.

loans.use: to increase their products with new collections in order to increase their income.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 30-year-old married woman and mother of three children.  She started her own business three years ago to support her family and help her husband meet their needs.

Fatima sells accessories, perfumes, cosmetics and clothes.  Now she is intending to expand her business and add a toys sector in addition to selling all bridal needs from lingerie to many other requested things, through a youth loan she applied for from Kiva partner Al Majmoua.

Fatima is well-known in the region and works hard to reply to most of her customer's needs all at the same time.  Fatima intends to expand her business more and more in the future to attract more customers.

loans.use: buy toys and bridal accessories

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 29-year-old married man and the father of two children.

Maher has worked in the international transportation business since 2002 on his own, with ten years of experience in this field. He owns a six-wheel truck and really enjoys his work because he discovers different countries on his way. Maher is a hard worker and he works his best to please his family.

Maher has been an Al Majmoua Kiva partner borrower for two cycles. His previous loan was supposed to be invested in his business through registering his newly bought truck, which he works on when he is in Lebanon and which he might rent to someone else to work on while he is away. But he was forced to use the loan for his wife's hospital expenses when she had to bring her beautiful baby to life.

He is so happy with his small family, but now it's time for business improvement. Maher is requesting a Youth Loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to register the truck and work officially on it, since he is not working on it as it should be.

loans.use: to register his truck.

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr: Madame Aida est âgée  de 48 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal et s’active dans le commerce de tissus. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par nécessité. Elle  est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  et sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs. Ce financement lui permettra d’honorer ses engagements vis-à-vis de ses fournisseurs. Grâce à son crédit  elle pourra développer son activité de commerce, accroitre ses bénéfices et assurer l’amélioration de son niveau de vie.
texts.en: Aida is 48 years old.  She lives in Senegal and is actively involved in the sale of fabrics.  She chose this activity out of necessity.  She is a member of one of the UIMCEC branches and is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs.  This loan will allow her to fulfill her commitments towards her suppliers. Thanks to this loan, she will also be able to develop her retail business, increase her profits and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to fulfill her commitments towards her suppliers.

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.ru: Уулкан  51 год, замужем,  воспитала 2 детей. Уулкан работает медсестрой в местной больнице. В 2005 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Уулкан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве с покупки 5 коз. Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Уулкан сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 10,000 сом (KGS) с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития совего бизнеса, Уулкан обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Уулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Uulkan is 51 years old, married, and has raised two children.  She works as a nurse at a local hospital.  In 2005, in search of a source of income for her family, she started her own animal husbandry business, starting with the purchase of 5 goats.  Through persistence and hard work, she was able to develop her business and now earns a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk and dairy products.  In order to further develop her business, Uulkan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS).  She plans to invest the profits from this loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Marina Roldan

texts.en:
Marina generates income by engaging in a hog-raising business. She and her husband live happily in a village, also planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. They aim to raise their status of living so they can educate their two children and give them a bright future. 

Marina hopes to improve and strengthen her hog-raising business and make it a viable source of income. Because she has insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 34,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed for hog-raising. She believes that her loan will enable her to make improvements in her business and hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed for hog-raising.

location.town: Brgy. Domang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Yei. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 28 years old and married with three children; two of them are still in school. 

Jane heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish to sell. She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Yei. She sells fish, and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old and married with four children; three of them are still in school. 

Joyce heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 600 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish to sell. She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Siama

texts.en:
Siama lives in Buluki. She sells bread, and has been in business for three years. She is 38 years old and married with five children; all of them are still in school. 

Siama heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase bread to sell. She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread to sell.

loans.name: Bannawag Martillano

texts.en:
Bannawag was not given the chance to finish his college level of education. Instead, he chose to build a hog-raising business for breeding and fattening five years ago. His goal in life is to give quality living to his family. He works hard and manages his business well to attain his goals.

Bannawag is 48 years of age, married and has two children that he is sending to school. Bannawag has plenty of hogs to feed. Sometimes he has difficulties in providing his hogs feed, because he is also providing his children allowances while they are in school. Bannawag is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy feed for his hogs. He believes the loan will be a big help for him to lessen his difficulties in maintaining the hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang is a local rice cultivator from Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is a responsible mother of three school-aged children and one married child. The three children have always helped on her farm, over the years, in their free time. Neang enjoys performing her daily tasks in the rice field.

Neang is looking for a loan from HKL to purchase a cow to keep working on her farm. With the balance, she will hire people to dig a well in her yard. Neang hopes to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to work on her farm.

loans.name: Moeurng

texts.en:
Moeurng is in her fifties and is a married woman who lives in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She works as a farmer as do many other villagers. Specifically, she grows rice crops. For additional income, Moeurng sells fresh fish and fermented fish paste in a neighbourhood market.  She can earn approximately USD 2.50 each day. She has four children, all of whom work in Phnom Penh city.

With the requested amount of HKR 1,200,000 Moeurng wants to add to her cash on hand to purchase fresh fish in bulk, from which fermented fish paste is made. She hopes to make a good income through the investment.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish in bulk.

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Hout, aged 60, is a loving father who has been cultivating rice for ages in Kompong Speu province. He is married and lives with his wife, four single children and two grandchildren. 

He now would like a loan from HKL to pay for house repairs. This is his first loan with our firm and he is confident he will repay his loan as scheduled punctually.

loans.use: to pay for house repairs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal and has been in this business for three years. She is 38 years old, married and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Victoria heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested 3000 Sudanese pounds to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal and has been in this business for three years. She is 35 years old, married and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Jane heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested 1000 Sudanese pounds to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan she will buy beads and embroidery thread of better quality and larger quantity. This will allow her to make more profit from her business.
Her husband works as a daily wage laborer. His income is not guaranteed because sometimes he doesn’t get any work.
Rehana is the mother of 4 sons. Two of them work while the others remain at home. Due to financial constraints, she couldn’t provide them with an education.
She is very confident that the loan will help her to improve her business and will make positive changes for her family’s financial future.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for her embroidery business

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian lives in Buluk. She has been running a food stall for three years. She is 38 years old, married and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Lillian heard about BRAC, South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested 800 Sudanese pounds to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
Hin, 31, is married and resides with his wife in Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh city. He works as a farmer in the rainy season and also in the construction field for extra income, earning USD 5.00 per day. He has 3 single children who are still students and depend on his support.

Hin would like a loan of USD 1,100 which will be his third loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner. He wants to purchase a couple of cows to expand his farming business. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house.

loans.use: to purchase a couple of cows to expand his farming business.

loans.name: Janety

texts.en:
Janety lives in Buluk. She has been running a food stall for three years. She is 40 years old, married and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Janety heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested 1000 Sudanese pounds to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Kevina

texts.en: Kevina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children. Three of her children are in school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a restaurant from home. She has been in business for the last 5 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of bananas, rice, cooking oil, and beef. Her major business challenges are defaulters and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to build a permanent house for her restaurant and also to own a fully-stocked restaurant. She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, rice, cooking oil, and beef

loans.name: Mega

texts.en: Mega lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (a brother). She has aretail shop at the market. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of 900,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. She generates additional income through selling charcoal and firewood. Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses and to own a delivery van to ease in transportation of commodities. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt  and boxes of soap

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children and all her children are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She is a tailor at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 4 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials and accessories. Her major business challenges are increasing prices of clothing materials and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand into a wholesale business. She lives in her own house but  the family has no access to electricity and  piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials and accessories
